title: Dungeon Delver
content:
Dungeon Delver You gain Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects and on Saving Throws made to avoid or resist traps. You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

You gain Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects and on Saving Throws made to avoid or resist traps.

You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps.

Dungeon Delver is a Feat in Baldur's Gate 3. Feats are special talents or expertise that provide special capabilities to characters. At certain levels, your character will get to choose between an Ability Score Improvement Feature or a Feat. (Note this feat is not available in EA and all info is subject to change.)

Dungeon Delver Information

You gain Advantage on Perception Checks made to detect hidden objects and on Saving Throws made to avoid or resist traps. You gain Resistance to the damage dealt by traps. Class Feature Dungeon Delver: Perception Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps

Dungeon Delver: Perception Dungeon Delver: Resist Traps

How to unlock Dungeon Delver

You'll need to fulfill the following requirements to unlock Dungeon Delver

All Classes Lvl 4

Dungeon Delver Tips & Notes

You usually have one character in your party with high perception, like your Rogue or your Ranger, maybe your bard or something like that. Giving them advantage just makes things easier for you. You can use Enhance Ability (Owl's Wisdom) to give them an advantage in spotting these things, which can save you a feat. But if you don't have someone that can cast Enhance Ability, it's not a bad one to take. As of Patch 5, this feat is broken, providing no advantage for trap detection rolls, while the damage reduction seems quite buggy, sometimes halving damage, and sometimes reducing it to 0.
